intro: Strobilanthes phyllostachya, commonly known as the flame flower or sacred flame, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red bracts that resemble flames. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Strobilanthes phyllostachya is not only ornamental but also holds cultural significance in some regions.
